name: coincidently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is coincident (= happening at the same time): coincidently with They timed the counterattack coincidently with the dictator's rise to power. It could also be depression that just occurred coincidently.
More examplesFewer examplesThe treaty was signed coincidently with the passage of the Aid Bill through Congress.The masses on the left side disappeared coincidently with improvement of the paralysis on the right side.Four of the calves were treated on consecutive days, coincidently with the excretion of salmonella.
